classification.susceptibility_note: Species might vary somewhat in in vitro susceptibility.

clinical_setting.summary: These are anaerobic streptococci that are part of the normal flora of the upper respiratory tract, pharynx, GI tract, and vagina.
clinical_setting.infections: Local infections like periodontal disease or endometritis can occur. Bacteremia can also ensue and may be complicated by brain abscess, endocarditis, or other focal infections.

primary.dosage: Dose depends on the site of infection. For meningitis/brain abscess, the dose is 18-24 million units per day.

alternative.dosage: Dose depends on the site of infection. IV dose ranges from 600-900 mg IV q8h (see Comment).

comments.clindamycin_resistance: One French study reported 28% resistance. Another study showed that the majority, but not all, of isolates were susceptible to Clindamycin, Moxifloxacin, Metronidazole, and Penicillins.
case_reports: A case report described successful treatment of a brain abscess with Linezolid.
A series of 15 cases of Peptoniphilus sp bloodstream infection has been published.
